intro: Malva houghtonii, commonly known as Houghton's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Malva houghtonii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
